text: Story Recap
▶ ▶ A mysterious celestial body entangled by Three Paths appears in the Memokeeper 's mirror — Amphoreus , The Eternal Land, the next stop for the Trailblaze .

▶ ▶ But the landing is not a smooth one. After surviving the crash, the Trailblaze squad meets the local Chrysos Heir heroes. They learn from them that the Titans supporting the world are rotting away, and that the land of Amphoreus is covered in scars.

▶ ▶ In Okhema , the final holy city, the two members of the squad undergo great trials and gain the trust of Aglaea, leader of the Chrysos Heirs. Facing a threat from beyond the fog, everyone decides to band together to defeat the Strife Titan Nikador .

▶ ▶ In order to destroy Nikador's true form, the group plans to infiltrate Castrum Kremnos of the past to discover the truth. At the end of the Abyss of Fate , the Trailblazer communes with the Time Titan Oronyx , and somehow receives a gaze from Fuli .

▶ ▶ With the help of their new friend Mem , everyone pieces together Nikador's divinity and obtains the Titan's Coreflame in the final battle. At last, the young hero Phainon faces his own trial in the holy Vortex of Genesis...
Await Phainon at the Vortex of Genesis

title: Mission Description
content: It's been a long while since Phainon entered the Vortex of Genesis for the Strife trial, leaving all Chrysos Heirs deeply concerned.

text: (Talk to Aglaea)

speaker: Mydei
line: Aglaea, with all due respect...

speaker: Mydei
line: This trial is taking far too long.

text: Don't worry. Have faith in Phainon.
Yeah, he's been gone for a while now...
Bah, it feels like we've already waited for forty-two days.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...How did you even arrive at that number?

speaker: Aglaea
line: What do you think of this, Trinnon ?

speaker: Trinnon
line: It's not possible to tell for sure what goes on within the Vortex. All I can hear are fragments of speech and distant battle cries...

speaker: Aglaea
line: Is it Phainon's voice?

speaker: Trinnon
line: I'm not sure. It's difficult to make out clearly...

speaker: Trinnon
line: ...Ah! Wait, no!

speaker: Castorice
line: Lady Trinnon?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Snowy's voice... I can't hear him anymore...

speaker: Trinnon
line: There's a sun-like existence in the trial... It's burning him up...!

speaker: Aglaea
line: It has come to this, after all...

speaker: Mydei
line: What now?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Get ready, Mydeimos.

text: What's going on?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Plan B. We pull him out when something goes wrong.

text: We need to stop the trial now.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Mm. Time for plan B.

text: Are you going to leave Phainon to die?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Why would we? The Coreflame is important to us, but it's beyond absurd to even consider sacrificing him to the Titans.

speaker: Mydei
line: As I promised you, Aglaea, I will intervene in the trial this time, to bring your Deliverer out to safety...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...But that's as far as I will go.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Of course. I know this is not the time to demand any more from you.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph, discerning. Alright then, to be as prepared as I can, I hope that the two outlander warriors can also join me.

speaker: Castorice
line: That... might not be a good idea. The Coreflame trial is many times more complicated than a standard ritual. Even the slightest misjudgment, misstep, or hiccup could result in grave consequences...

speaker: Castorice
line: Our two distinguished guests are not obliged to risk their lives for the Flame-Chase Journey. Let me join you instead, Lord Mydei.

text: It's fine. We've got this.
Exactly. No way am I getting involved.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: This is a rare opportunity, though... The Coreflame has something to do with the workings of Amphoreus. It's best for us to learn more.

text: Can't we all go together?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: No, someone should stay outside in case we need help.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Things have taken a critical turn, especially so with Phainon's life on the line. Of course, we Nameless will do what is necessary. How should we help?

speaker: Mydei
line: Join me in the trial to look for Phainon. And when we do, Aglaea's golden threads will guide us back out...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...assuming we survive Nikador's wrath.

speaker: Mydei
line: If something bad were to happen, Castorice, your priority is to ensure the safety of these two. I can find a way out on my own.

speaker: Castorice
line: ...Yes, Lord Mydei.

speaker: Mydei
line: Thank you both for your valor. Time to get to work, then. Let me have the honor of...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...taking the lead in this battle.

text: Speak with Aglaea and interfere with the trial

title: Step Description
content: When crisis struck during Phainon's Coreflame trial as we waited anxiously, we made the snap decision to join Castorice and Mydei in rescuing Phainon from possible peril.

text: (Talk to Castorice, optional)

speaker: Castorice
line: Please... stay safe.

text: (Talk to Trinnon, optional)

speaker: Trinnon
line: We can't get rid of... all the noise...

text: (Talk to Dan Heng, optional)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Let's also make our way to the front of the spirit basin when you're ready.

text: (Talk to Aglaea)

speaker: Aglaea
line: May that warrior be safe from harm. When you are ready, I will preside over the ritual on Trinnon's behalf.

text: Let's go.
Give me a minute.

children.speaker: Aglaea
children.line: No problem. We should only begin when everyone is fully prepared.

text: Interfere with the trial
(EnterExploratory ExcursionTrial of Strife)

speaker: Aglaea
line: ▶ (Trailblazer) and Dan Heng, our reinforcements from beyond the sky, warriors of high esteem—

speaker: Aglaea
line: Please close your eyes and hold your breath...

speaker: Aglaea
line: They once kept the fate of this world and many other challengers safe from the devastating rage of Strife...

speaker: Aglaea
line: They now seek to venture deep into the trial of divinity and prove their will to destroy our enemies, as foretold by the prophecy...

speaker: Aglaea
line: When the hammer of Strife strikes the anvil of the warrior, the heat and impact will leave behind scars, and between them, a demigod shall rise...

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Very well. Come forth, then..."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "...Souls foreign to this realm and warriors in the making."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Follow me into the mist and flames, and come face to face with the greatest fear in the depths of a warrior's heart."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "And with thy strength, banish the darkness and usher in sunlight — let all lost souls find courage on a long journey back home."

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (What...)

speaker: Mydei
line: What's the matter? Surprised?

speaker: Mydei
line: Where there's Strife, there's carnage... It shouldn't come as a surprise to see such a sight in Nikador's trial.

text: You... did this?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: I told you, this is only a mirror of the trial.

text: Let's go look for Phainon.
Why is it just you? Where's Dan Heng?

speaker: Mydei
line: I don't see him around here... We should go first. Let's pray he stays safe.

text: Seek out Phainon and Dan Heng

title: Step Description
content: (Trailblazer) and I became separated in this illusion. (Trailblazer) told me that(he/she)travelled with Mydei and had seen the man's deepest fear, which was the blood-soaked glory of the Kremnos...

speaker: Mydei
line: "The greatest fear in the depths of a warrior's heart," huh? ...So, this is what he fears the most?

text: (Idle chats)

speaker: Adult Female C
line: There's no place for you in Amphoreus!

speaker: Adult Female B
line: A disaster for Okhema...

speaker: Adult Female A
line: So much for the king of those outlanders...

text: Follow the escaping solider and investigate the commotion

speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
line: You won't get away, Kremnoan vermin!

speaker: Mydei
line: Be on alert. The smell of rust is thick in the air.

text: (Idle chats, unnamed & unvoiced NPCs)
Haha... the sweet taste of blood...
Offer yourself to Strife!
Strife is on my side!
Perish, you coward!
You... barbaric bloodseeker...
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
line: Tell me your name, brute! Your demise shall be a tale I boast about at the feast table!

speaker: Perdikkas
line: My name is Perdikkas... And I am here to avenge my people.

speaker: Mydei
line: Kremnoans... and Okhemans are at war?

speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
line: Hahaha! ...Perdikkas? Even the tragic cries of beasts at the slaughterhouse sound better than your name!

speaker: Perdikkas
line: Say whatever you like, despicable Okheman...

speaker: Perdikkas
line: "Valorous Death Before Glorious Return." May the Kremnoan spirit always watch over me!

speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
line: Foolish brute! I see you're eager to die. Very well then, I shall grant you just that!

text: Intervene and stop the soldier.

children.speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
children.line: You are...? Oh, so the alpha brute has found his way here?

children.speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
children.line: It's a pity, though... You're too late! You will never stop the holy city's army. Watch as I make this pathetic warrior of yours the first sacrifice!

children.speaker: Perdikkas
children.line: Urk... Hngh...

children.speaker: Perdikkas
children.line: Mydeimos ... My king...

children.speaker: Perdikkas
children.line: Avenge... me...!

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Is this...

children.speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
children.line: You're next!

text: Watch on and wait for the trial.

children.speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
children.line: Die, you swine!

children.speaker: Perdikkas
children.line: Urk... Hngh...

children.speaker: Perdikkas
children.line: Mydeimos ... My king...

children.speaker: Perdikkas
children.line: Why... why did you leave us to the mercy of these foreigners?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Is this...

children.speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
children.line: You are...? Oh, so the alpha brute has found his way here!

children.speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
children.line: You Kremnoans are all eager to die, huh? Then I shall grant you a swift death!

speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
line: *sound of a body contorting and snapping*

speaker: Frenzied Okheman Soldier
line: Face your death, cowardly king...!

text: (Begin battle againstFuriae Warrior×1,Furiae Philosopher×1,Furiae Troupe×1,Furiae Archer×1)

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: This insatiable bloodlust... is a product of Nikador 's wrath.

text: (After the battle)

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Absurd. I know this Okheman. Strife contorted an honorable warrior into this perverse and twisted being.

speaker: Mydei
line: And that horrible noise... I can hardly suppress my bloodlust when it sounds.

speaker: Mydei
line: This battle cry must have gotten to Phainon. That's why he lost himself... Hmph, what a useless fool.

text: Who is he?
Why so solemn...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...It's nothing. Let's go.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Urk...!

speaker: Mydei
line: That voice... is Chartonus?

text: Check Chartonus' current condition

speaker: Mydei
line: Not you too, Chartonus...

text: (Try to communicate with the pair of warriors by the start of the Exploratory Excursion, optional)

speaker: Fanatical Kremnoan
line: Come at me, coward! Nikador will grant me strength and fight alongside me to the death!

speaker: Bloodthirsty Okheman
line: Hmph, those are some big words for a pathetic rat like you... No different from your cowardly king!

text: (Try to communicate with the warrior standing over some bodies by the space anchor, optional)

speaker: Mesmerized Warrior
line: Ha... Haha...

speaker: Mesmerized Warrior
line: Please accept my offering, Nikador ...

text: This person is consumed by a frenzy of slaughter, oblivious to your presence.
(Try to communicate with the dying citizen, optional)
A sharp bronze spear had torn through the tendons in her arm, leaving it hanging lifelessly, like a shattered wine jug abandoned by the roadside.
As the soul ebbed away, darkness veiled her eyes.
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Chartonus
line: Mydeimos, you are...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Destroyed all, the wicked king... Here to take my life, finally?

speaker: Mydei
line: I won't ask how this happened, nor will I hurt you like you said.

speaker: Mydei
line: I just need you to tell me where Phainon is.

speaker: Chartonus
line: All of this, you know very well. Leave our city, cursed son of Gorgo !

speaker: Mydei
line: I have no intention of hurting you, Chartonus!

speaker: Chartonus
line: Humiliate me, you shall not. Leave. Get out of Okhema!

speaker: Chartonus
line: Get out! Symbol of your sovereignty, take it! Signet of Kremnos, bask in blood-soaked glory, your kind alone!

speaker: Mydei
line: This is... Mother 's signet?

speaker: Mydei
line: It's here again. I knew it...!

speaker: Chartonus
line: Hah! Finally gone mad, despicable vermin have. With your mad king, perish together, in that maelstrom of battle!

speaker: Mydei
line: Enough, be quiet! You are not at all Chartonus—

speaker: Mydei
line: —Look out!

text: A long, narrow shadow pierces through the phantom of Chartonus...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Nice move.

speaker: Dan Heng?
line: You, too.

text: Are you... the real Dan Heng?

children.speaker: Dan Heng?
children.line: I could ask you the same—

text: Are we up against Dan Heng's apparition this time...?

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Wait. He seems calm and composed, unlike the rest.

children.speaker: Dan Heng?
children.line: Sane enough to communicate, it seems. Hey, gray-haired warrior. Tell me—

speaker: Dan Heng?
line: —What was the last thing you said to me before I parted the waters at the Scalegorge Waterscape ?

speaker: Mydei
line: Parted the waters...?

text: How would I even remember that?!

children.speaker: Dan Heng?
children.line: Hmm, that sounds like something the real you would say.

text: Ugh. Forget it. Just kill me, alright?

children.speaker: Dan Heng?
children.line: Hmm, that sounds like something the real you would say.

children.speaker: Dan Heng?
children.line: That's right. You have a great memory.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It wasn't easy, but I finally found you two...

speaker: Mydei
line: So, you are Dan Heng. What did you go through before meeting us?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Just some memories from my past. Nothing worth mentioning.

speaker: Mydei
line: You mean you saw your past too?

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph... The trial of Strife is a vicious one, alright.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What are you thinking?

speaker: Mydei
line: This might not be a single person's trial... but an arena for every challenger to engage their own delusions in a bloody battle.

speaker: Mydei
line: I saw someone from my past a while ago... Someone Phainon has never met.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hmm... That doesn't exactly sound like a bad thing. At least it means that we'll be able to find Phainon here.

speaker: Mydei
line: We can only hope this battlefield is nowhere as extensive as I imagine it to be...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Let's first follow the sounds of battle to their source.

text: Find the battle cries and find the source of Strife

title: Step Description
content: We finally met up in the illusion of the trial after some fighting and followed the sound of battle to the source of Strife. Perhaps that would be Phainon's location.

speaker: Mydei
line: The battle cries... seem to be getting a lot louder.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I have a feeling...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Someone is manipulating this battlefield, someone who might not be Phainon.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmm... I agree.

text: (Idle chats)

speaker: Adult Male D
line: This will be the end of you outlanders!

speaker: Adult Male E
line: Go find your friends in hell!

speaker: Adult Male F
line: Cursed brutes...

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Mydei
line: Heh. Just as I thought. This is where the battle cries were coming from...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...The true entrance to Nikador's trial.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What's wrong with you two?

text: I've met that warrior before...
It's Gnaeus , an incarnation of Nikador...

speaker: Mydei
line: I'm seeing him for the first time, but there's no doubt about it. What I'm sensing can only be Strife's bloodlust...

speaker: Mydei
line: The one manipulating this battlefield is... Nikador themself.

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Ah, Mydeimos... You are a keen warrior, indeed."

speaker: Mydei
line: You know me?

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "The blasphemous prince. Of course I know you."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "And I happen to know that you're here for the soul of that white-haired warrior."

speaker: Mydei
line: Great. Let's cut to the chase, then. Hand over that poor excuse for a swordmaster so we can be done with this farce.

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "I applaud your courage and strength for coming this far. But you have chosen to besmirch the dignity of one who has fallen, and I cannot turn a blind eye to that."

text: This is gonna be one fierce battle we won't be able to get out of.
Won't you go easy on us? We traveled together before, remember...?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: One who has fallen...? Phainon failed the trial?

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "He faced the greatest fear in the depths of his heart and fought with exceptional valor, though he eventually succumbed to the brutal onslaughts. I have since brought him to the rear battleground, and granted him glory worthy of his courage, tenacity, and sacrifice."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "You wish to take him away? Sure. Pick up a spear and prove that your resolve can rival his..."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Of course... cowards who hope to avoid bloodshed are better off disappearing from my sight this instant."

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph. Your opinions are of no interest to me, mad king...

speaker: Mydei
line: If it's a fight you're looking for, then you will get one, Titan. I will put you to rest once more with my curse of immortality.

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Commendable! Your noble mother displayed the same spirit with a spear in her hands."

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Don't you dare speak of her.

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Why not? She challenged the former Kremnos king to a duel, even knowing that it was a deadly trap, all to protect your dignity. Are you suggesting her efforts were for naught?"

speaker: Mydei
line: Her tragic death was caused by you, the incarnation of Strife. How dare you talk about her past?

speaker: Mydei
line: Enough of this nonsense. You should be wielding your weapon as the god of Strife! Battle me and put a swift end to this!

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Hah! Your hatred is as clear as day, Mydeimos. My words must have stung you deeply. But thanks to them, I have also come to realize..."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "This is why you killed your father for the throne, only to let your signet sink to the bottom of the Sea of Souls, refusing to let the glory of Kremnos live on..."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "This is why you slew the Strife Titan, only to reject the Coreflame, letting Strife continue instead..."

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "O child abandoned by fate, show me what you are capable of. Show me if you have the power to put out the flames of your very own destiny ."

speaker: Mydei
line: I will rip your chest apart, Titan... In the same way I ripped apart that former king.

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "Hahaha, I see you wish to repeat your mistake. Come at me, then. Ignite the flames of your fears and step onto the battlefield. Take this fierce battle to the boundaries of Strife and consume me, or lose yourself in the fight and watch your defeated corpse burn to ash!"

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "But remember this, Mydeimos: The son of Gorgo will be crowned in blood—!"

speaker: Divine Echo
line: "The very moment you rip my chest apart shall be the moment of your ascension. To you, the successor of Kremnos!"

text: (Enter battle)

(Second wave: Furiae Warrior ×1 , Furiae Archer ×2 , Furiae Praetor ×1 ) ▶ Divine Echo: "In the name of fairness, I grant you the blood of Strife!" (On Mydei's turn) ▶ Mydei: This raging power... I can hardly contain it... (Third wave: Furiae Philosopher ×1 , Furiae Praetor ×1 , Furiae Archer ×1 ) ▶ Divine Echo: "In fear you shall abandon your mortal body, King of Kremnos!" (On Mydei's turn) ▶ Mydei: How noisy...!

children.speaker: Divine Echo
children.line: "That white-haired warrior knew he was no match for me, yet he chose to fight till his very last breath..."

children.speaker: Divine Echo
children.line: "What about you, Mydeimos? Can your murderous intent match up to what fate has in store for you!?"

children.speaker: Divine Echo
children.line: "Prove to me that you are worthy of this power!"

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Mournful cries... Miserable wails...

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Kings of Kremnos, this is the power you desired?

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: Watch out!

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Found you...!

text: (Cutscene ends)
Some time later...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...I did my best.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Coreflame trial is indeed no place for the weak. Let's just hope that Phainon gets through this.

speaker: Aglaea
line: There is no need to worry. His soul is in a stable condition. With ample rest for both body and mind, he'll be up and about in no time.

speaker: Castorice
line: The greatest fear in the depths of his heart... Lord Phainon must have been forced to relive his past during the trial and revisit his homeland that had fallen to the black tide ...

speaker: Mydei
line: ...In all likelihood.

text: Is the black tide really that scary?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Since coming to Amphoreus, we have heard many talking about this "black tide." Could you tell us more about it?

text: It's only normal to be unable to overcome your inner demons.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Since coming to Amphoreus, we have heard many talking about this "black tide." Could you tell us more about it?

text: I think Gnaeus mentioned it before...

children.speaker: Castorice
children.line: That is correct. He was willing to entrust the Coreflame to the Chrysos Heirs... because he was also pinning his hopes on us, to succeed him in shouldering the responsibility of resisting the black tide.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Could you tell us more about this "black tide"?

speaker: Aglaea
line: It is one of the culprits that drives the people of Amphoreus to madness. It was during the Era Bellica that this... unspeakable thing first appeared, like a plague, alongside the Three Titans of Calamity .

speaker: Aglaea
line: Nobody knows where it came from or how it came to be. What we do know, however, is that it is steadily encroaching upon what little remains of this tranquil land, much like a rising sea closing in on an island from all sides. It is for this very reason that it became known as the "black tide."

speaker: Aglaea
line: Those who succumb to it lose their reason and humanity, becoming vicious, mindless monsters. Mortals are not the only ones susceptible to its influence — even gods and Titans cannot escape from it.

speaker: Castorice
line: According to Gnaeus, Nikador , though one of the embodiments of Calamity, also bears the responsibility of fending off the black tide...

speaker: Castorice
line: Perhaps that is also why Lord Phainon threw himself into the trial of Strife so readily.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But now, we must look for alternative means of igniting the flames of Strife.

speaker: Mydei
line: So, Aglaea, what should we do now?

speaker: Aglaea
line: You know very well the decision doesn't lie with me.

speaker: Aglaea
line: As the successor to Kremnos, Mydei, you know better than anyone that if it were simply about emerging triumphant on the battlefield of Strife, you and your people could manage it with ease.

speaker: Aglaea
line: But ultimately... the heavy burden of divinity can only be borne by one.

speaker: Aglaea
line: It is foolhardiness and indecision, not the unclaimed seat of divinity, that pushes this world into the deathly fog.

text: (UnlockAchievementSing, O Goddess, of His Rage)
Return to your private bath chamber and discuss the present circumstances with Dan Heng

title: Step Description
content: After ensuring Phainon's safety, (Trailblazer) and I retreated to the bath chamber to rest. We also drew our own conclusions about the present situation in the world of Amphoreus

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The black tide...

text: (Investigate the door, optional)
Phainon was defeated in the Trial of Strife and had his consciousness corroded by the Titan. It will be some time until he recovers... Let the frustrated hero rest a while.
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: An "unspeakable" thing of "unknown origin"... What comes to your mind when we put these keywords together?

text: A Stellaron ?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That's right. If you think about the various characteristics of Amphoreus — an isolated world of eternal night being eroded by an unknown power... we cannot discount this possibility.

text: An Aeon ?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That's right. If you think about the various characteristics of Amphoreus — an isolated world of eternal night being eroded by an unknown power... we cannot discount this possibility.

text: Uhh... a Leviathan ? A cosmic mega octopus?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...A hypothesis like that has never occurred to me, I must admit. But considering how the Leviathan hasn't been sighted in the universe for hundreds of Amber Eras , I think the possibility of it being the culprit is minuscule.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Let's think about the various characteristics of Amphoreus instead. An isolated world of eternal night being eroded by an unknown power...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: This has been bothering me for a while now. Everything we have seen thus far suggests that Amphoreus wasn't always isolated from the rest of the universe. Be it the birth of the Titans or the encroaching black tide, none of these can be explained as a "natural progression" of a civilization.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There must be other reasons for its current state of isolation. It's just... if the Cancer of All Worlds is truly the culprit, then we should have observed certain phenomena — explicit or otherwise — by now, but that isn't the case.

text: The Voice of the Stellaron?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That's what I was thinking too. From past experience, the Stellaron within you should be able to resonate with other Stellarons, but we haven't encountered anything like that here.

text: The Antimatter Legion ?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That's what I was thinking too. From past experience, the Destruction has always been involved in some way when it comes to a world corrupted by a Stellaron.

text: The Stellaron Hunters ?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: That's what I was thinking too. From past experience, Stellaron Hunters are certain to appear on a world with a Stellaron.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: There are several other unanswered questions, too. My gut feeling is that things here are not as simple as they seem...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Furthermore, what happened in Penacony also proved that the appearance of a world may not necessarily be due to the influence of just one Path.

text: No sweat! The Trailblaze can tackle even ten Paths if it must!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: *sigh* It's good to be motivated at least.

text: It could be an all-star cast.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Heh... In another sense, it's Penacony all over again.

text: Who knows, maybe Akivili 's behind it all.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Not even the History Fictionologists would dare to spin a tale like that.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: For now, let's just take things as they come. The black tide could be a good starting point. Since Nikador has fallen, those who were suppressed by them will no doubt begin to counterattack now.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: It seems our trailblazing expedition is growing in significance...

text: Mydei's people, the Kremnoans, seem to have other plans for the divine authority of Strife. Before overcoming the trial, he must first gain the trust of his people...
